pages.text: Inspirations is yet another "a lot of small features" type of mod, but what it has to offer is pretty neat! Here's some spotlights.

pages.title: Bookshelves
pages.text: Inspirations' Bookshelves are functional and good-looking. They can store all kinds of books, enchanted or otherwise, which can easily be retrieved by right-clicking them. Shift-right-click to access all of its stored books. They come in every wood flavor, and even different book styles (rainbow, ancient, etc)

pages.title: Carpets
pages.text: With Inspirations, carpets can be placed on stairs. Carpets can also be crafted with trapdoors to hide them.

Ropes, Vine Ropes, and Climbing Chains are all very handy blocks that hang under a block and can be climbed up. You can place them below each other by right-clicking the top block, almost like vanilla scaffolding.
Collectors are kind of like reverse hoppers. When they recieve a redstone pulse, they will pull items out of the inventory they are facing. They are placed facing away from you, like Observers.
Ducts are just minified, single-slot hoppers (that can also flow upwards!)

Locks, once named in an anvil, will let you lock Chest-like containers. Locked containers can only be accessed with keys named the same thing as the lock, so don't forget the "password"!$(br2)$(#FFFAEF)$(m)This doesn't actually prevent others from breaking them tho
The Redstone Charger powers a single block for about a second. It's useful for testing your circuits. If you use it while sneaking, the pulse will last for only 1 redstone tick.
